ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Primary complaint of constant, bothersome ringing (TFI 82/100), exacerbated by stress.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry shows mixed loss; history of noise exposure (sensorineural) and ear infections (conductive).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Diagnosed by psychiatrist; symptoms (flashbacks, anxiety) exacerbate tinnitus and dizziness.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds given complaints of tinnitus and noise exposure.
To assess speech understanding and check for retrocochlear signs (rollover/asymmetry).
To evaluate middle ear function given history of infections and air-bone gaps.
To screen for retrocochlear pathology and check middle ear status.
To assess outer hair cell function, particularly regarding noise exposure history.
To quantify the functional impact of tinnitus on quality of life.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation revealed asymmetrical mixed hearing loss, worse in the right ear, consistent with the patient's history of occupational noise exposure and bilateral otitis media. Tinnitus is causing significant distress (TFI 82/100). The asymmetry and unilateral tinnitus, combined with reported dizziness, necessitated referrals for medical and vestibular evaluation, which were subsequently unremarkable.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal low frequencies sloping to severe mixed loss in high frequencies. Left ear: Normal sloping to moderate mixed loss. Air-bone gaps at 250, 1000, 4000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs consistent with pure tones (Right 25 dB, Left 5 dB). WRS excellent in Right (94%) and good in Left (88%).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A bilaterally; Right ear showed negative pressure (-95 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral absent at 500-2000 Hz. Left ipsilateral absent at 500 Hz, present at 1000-2000 Hz.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (DPOAE)
tests.result_summary: Right: Pass at 3000 Hz, refer elsewhere. Left: Pass 1500-4000 Hz. Consistent with hearing loss.

tests.name: Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI)
tests.result_summary: Overall score 82/100, indicating significant negative impact on daily life.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: At the 1-month hearing aid check, the patient reported high satisfaction with the hearing aids and Zen programs, noting tinnitus had become much less noticeable. Objective measures confirmed good benefit and consistent usage.

tests.name: Data logging
tests.result_summary: Average of 14 hours of daily use.

tests.name: AzBio sentences
tests.result_summary: 94% aided score in quiet compared to 76% unaided.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: At the 6-month follow-up, the patient reported a reduction in tinnitus annoyance and anxiety. Audiologic testing showed slight improvement in low-frequency thresholds in the right ear, likely due to resolution of conductive components, though high-frequency asymmetry persisted. TFI scores indicated a significant reduction in the negative impact of tinnitus.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Slight improvement in right ear low frequencies; high-frequency asymmetry persists.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear showed high compliance (suggestive of excessive TM mobility) and an opaque TM. Left ear was normal.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent at all tested frequencies bilaterally.

proposed_items: Widex Zen Therapy (Zen Aqua, Zen Noise programs)
Custom-molded earplugs with filters for shooting range
Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) for PTSD and tinnitus reaction
counseling_actions: Discuss the mixed nature of hearing loss (noise damage plus history of infections)
Explain the relationship between stress, PTSD, and tinnitus perception
Validate dizziness while reassuring that VNG/MRI ruled out dangerous causes
Counsel on use of Widex Zen mobile application
Educate on hearing protection for recreational shooting

red_flags_present: Episodes of dizziness with a fall

escalation.rationale_short: ENT referral to rule out retrocochlear pathology (MRI) and vestibular dysfunction (VNG) due to asymmetry and dizziness; Psychiatry referral to manage PTSD symptoms.

follow_up_plan.timeline: 1 month for hearing aid check, then 6 months for re-evaluation
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds, assess hearing aid benefit and usage, and re-evaluate tinnitus impact.

expected_outcome: AzBio sentences in quiet (1 month): 94% aided score compared to 76% unaided, indicating good benefit.
Tinnitus Functional Index (6 months): Overall score decreased to 60.4/100 (from 82/100 baseline), indicating reduced negative impact.
Pure-tone audiometry (6 months): Slight improvement in right ear low frequencies due to resolution of conductive components; high-frequency asymmetry persists.
Tympanometry (6 months): High compliance in the right ear suggestive of excessive tympanic membrane mobility; opaque right tympanic membrane noted.
Acoustic reflexes (6 months): Absent at all tested frequencies bilaterally.
Patient reported significant reduction in anxiety and tinnitus bother following 20 weeks of CBT and hearing aid use.
